Title: Jelly Star - The World's Smallest Android 13 Smartphone
Description: Introducing Unihertz Jelly Star - The world's smallest Android 13 smartphone with a transparent design and LED light. This phone packs advanced features into a credit card-sized body, including an Octa-Core 6nm MediaTek Helio G99 processor, 8GB RAM, 256GB of storage memory, and a powerful 48MP rear camera. With a 3-inch screen, the Jelly Star is incredibly portable and perfect for on-the-go use. Plus, its unique transparent back and LED light make it a conversation starter. Don't miss out on this innovative phone that has received overwhelming attention from phone tech enthusiasts. Order now!

Title: GUIs are Antisocial
Description:
Last week, I was listening to the CoRecursive podcast interview with PowerShell’s lead architect, Jeffrey Snover.
One moment in that interview has been stuck in my head the whole week is when Snover argues that graphical user interfaces (GUIs) are inherently “antisocial”:
I realized that — you know, that the mouse is antisocial. The GUI is antisocial. So what’s that mean? You have a problem to solve, and you solve it with the GUI.

Title: The Tragedies of Reality Are Coming for You

Use pg_easy_replicate for setting up Logical Replication and Switchover in PostgreSQL
Description: pg_easy_replicate is a CLI orchestrator tool that makes the process of setting up and managing logical replication between PostgreSQL databases a breeze.

Title: The missing parts in Cargo
Description: When people discuss the merits of Rust, they often mention its strict ownership rules, excellent diagnostics, and impressive performance. Cargo and the crates.io ecosystem frequently receive praise as well. Initially, when I started learning Rust, I couldn’t understand why Cargo was so highly loved. Having extensive experience with JavaScript, I was accustomed to convenient package managers and couldn’t grasp the enthusiasm—wasn’t such a tool a given for any serious programming language?

Title: How to build better social media?

Description: A curated list of indie blogs that I follow and recommend. These blogs are written by individuals who share their thoughts, experiences, and knowledge on a variety of topics.
